body.name: The Cure: A Young Adult Dystopian Novel (The Cure Chronicles, Book 1)
body.description: Before the Blight, becoming an adult was something teenagers looked forward to. But now, turning 18 means certain death.Unless you prove yourself worthy of the Cure.On her 17th birthday, Ashen Spencer is blindfolded and escorted to the massive, mysterious building known as the Arc to begin her year of training and testing in hopes that she can earn the Cure - a powerful drug given only to those deemed worthy to survive beyond their 18th birthday. Ashen has a chance to rise up from her former life of squalor and be granted a place in society, if the Panel - the mysterious group of powerful men and women in charge of the Arc - deems her year a success. She's assigned to live for twelve months with a wealthy family whose son is the most alluring young man she's ever met. At first, Ashen is grateful for the opportunity to earn her place in a society she's always dreamed of inhabiting. But as time passes and she begins to learn the truth about the people she admires so much and the home she left behind, she realizes she has a choice: Be part of the disease.... Or be part of the Cure. For fans of The Hunger Games, Divergent, and The Selection. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVED THIS BOOK
reviews.reviewText: Amazing from start to finish. I am currently on book 3, and I have loved them all so far. This book is very similar to The Hunger Games but has it's own story unfold especially in book 3.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Do you like The Hunger Games?Do you like The Maze Runner?Do you like The Giver?Do you like Divergent?Do you like ENDERS Game?Then you'll like this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good read
reviews.reviewText: Beautifully written and great plot. The love side of the plot fell a bit flat. Maybe it’s intentional? Guess I will find out in the 2nd book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The premise of the story, Seventeens being the solution for the Blight, is a good one. The storyline is good too. However, the writing is shallow. It moves too fast to develop the characters and the setting in any meaningful way. The main characters don't have any depth and it's difficult to really like or dislike them. Will I read the rest of the series? Maybe, but only if I need a fast simple read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Dystopian adventure meets strong female protagonist and prescient future tech
reviews.reviewText: KA Riley has crafted an excellent adventure into dystopian land with this first in the series The Cure. This was my first time reading her work and I’m an instant fan. I can understand why this novel and others are slowly climbing the bestseller rankings. The title is well-deserved.Thinking she’s entering the sweepstakes for the cure to the disease ravaging the adults in her neighborhood, Ashen willingly enters the Arc for a year of “testing” to prove herself (and so she’s been told her family) worthy of receiving the precious medicine. She soon realizes she’s entered not a utopia but the worst sort of dystopian life, and that’s when the fun begins.I won’t spoil it, as you NEED TO READ THIS BOOK! It had been on my TBR for months and now I’m wondering why I didn’t bump it up. Don’t make the same mistake, as you’ll want to read through this now complete series and probably start a few more of her newer series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Meaty plot but cardboard characters
reviews.reviewText: I've read through the series so Ill be posting a comment for the first and last book. The plot is good really good like taking the award home at the end of the day kind of good but the characters are cardboard or comic book style if you will. You have one point of view but many characters with only base line thought and some of the lines were so cheeseball they made me laugh. The main character seems a bit empty headed reiterating the same thoughts with not much else. Its worth the read and dear author I can't wait to see what you do in the future for their is so much potential in your ideas but your skill set is lacking for the proper greatness your ideas deserve. I mean that only in the best way and thank you for sharing your books with the world.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun to Read
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the pace of this book and found it overall enjoyable. I also appreciated that the book didn’t end on a cliffhanger, but left the reader anticipating the next part of the main character’s story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was a quick read but a good one, I enjoyed the plot! Starting the next book the series next!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect next read for dystopian fans needing a new series
reviews.reviewText: This book was great and I can't wait to read the rest of the series. If your a fan of The Hunger Games, Maze Runner, Matched and other similar dystopian, then listen up cause this book series is for you.Ashen is a 17 yr old who has the chance to change her family's lives finds out that the opportunity may not be all that it seems.She is an intelligent and independent girl who fights in more ways then one for her values.A compelling story that is beautifully told, would recommend it to anyone needing a new world to drive into.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 6, 2021
reviews.reviewText: K. A. Riley has managed to intertwine so many different parts from her other near future dystopian novels, that although they all incorporate different universes, you immediately feel comfortable with each new universe. This universe is no different, and we finally get to see what life is really like in the huge, darkly mysterious Arcologies inhabited by the wealthy and the elite.I can't wait for the next installment in The Cure Chronicles.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy read with an intriguing story
reviews.reviewText: This is an engaging book with relatable characters. The storyline and wording are similar to other books that I have read but are different enough to make it unique and interesting.

With an easy to follow storyline and solid character development, The Cure is definitely the most enjoyable read this year for me (2022)Some books have so much going on that there is a tendency to get lost and forget what the original point was.Not here.I have a feeling the one question I have will be answered in the 3rd and I can't wait to get there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 7, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Move over Hunger Games because theres a new fandom in town! This is honestly one of the best books I have ever read. You dont see the plot twists coming and they come so hard you get whiplash! Highly recommend this book to anyone and everyone. It will make you fall in love from page one.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.
